intro: Bulbinella trinervis, commonly known as the Three-veined Bulbinella, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with three distinct veins. Bulbinella trinervis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
